description: The El Comahue beekeepers' cooperative, the largest in RÃ­o Negro, promotes sustainable beekeeping, enhancing biodiversity through pollination. Established with government support, it comprises 28 members who collectively produce high-quality honey and honey wax. The cooperative model ensures food safety, profitability, and a strong community, attracting new beekeepers, including those seeking additional income. Their future plans include expanding membership and exploring export opportunities, highlighting the cooperative's success and potential for growth.
name: El Comahue
